poem:
*Charitable Act*

In a land where winters are stern,
a hand extends fifty whispers of hope
to the other side of despair.
Twelve years, an eternity of seasons,
for a coin's soft clink
that crossed the boundary 
of heavy silence
and iron resolve.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The charge against Karelina was based on a donation of just over". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
